Key Match Events: Rodrygo's goal in the 29th minute broke the deadlock, and Ecuador almost levelled in a counterattack right before the break, but Gabriel Magalhaes denied Moises Caicedo's effort with a last-minute goal-line clearance.
Post-Match Reflections: Rodrygo expressed happiness with the victory and hoped it would help the team progress to a higher level.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Brazil's performance was lacklustre, dominating possession but failing to create clear chances throughout the match.
Ecuador applied physically aggressive pressure high with three hardworking forwards, making the locals uncomfortable when putting the ball in play.
Others: Brazil returned to winning ways in the South American World Cup qualifiers with a drab 1-0 victory over Ecuador.
Brazil will face Paraguay at Asuncion on Tuesday while Ecuador is set to host Peru in Quito on Monday.
